d: Top 10 ways to Ditch Your Clutter and Digitally Organize Your Life
Disentanglement - rageprufrock
n:
After the abject shitshow of Palo Alto, Eduardo's plans are to stop proving his father right about all his life decisions, shut up, graduate, and keep abusing the slow-healing wound from Mark's knife in the back until all the scar tissue is numb from dead nerve endings. // 

As with all of Pru's work, I'm left wordless and full of feelings (not sure what type or kind) at the end of it. It's amazing and you should read it. Also, seems rather apropos that the last fic I'll probably ever read in this fandom is by Pru.

d: A Handsome Atlas: Wildly Awesome Data Visualizations from the Nineteenth Century
n:
What's the story?
After the Civil War, the US doubled down on the Census, cranking out stunning maps, charts, and graphs.

About what?
Literally everything. Liquor, lumber, Methodists, malaria, insanity, Irishmen: everything!

Not Your Grandfather's Data Visualizations
Probably your great-great-grandfather's, though. But frankly: they're all awesome and modern.

Everything from wild maps to small multiples and chloropleths. And plenty of pie charts.

d: Ego Driven Development - Deliberate Software
n:
"Not Invented Here" syndrome
Little to no test coverage of domain logic
No dedicated UI person for external user interfaces or no actual user testing
No dedicated QA for externally-facing software
"Ivory Tower" or "Architecture Astronaut" team leads
Broad skill level spectrum
No pair programming
Micro-management in some areas, no management in others
Agile “Lite”
Low Joel Test score

d: Persona | MDN
n: Mozilla Persona is a completely decentralized and secure authentication system for the web based on the open BrowserID protocol. To ensure that Persona works everywhere and for everyone, Mozilla currently operates a small suite of optional, centralized services related to Persona.
